ARABIC: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍۭ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They said, 'Are we to forsake our gods for a mad poet?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And said: "Should we abandon our gods for the sake of an insane poet?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and said: “Shall we forsake our deities for the sake of a distracted poet?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and said, "Should we give up our idols for the sake of an insane poet".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And they used to say, “Shall we forsake our Gods upon the sayings of a mad poet?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (they) said: "Are we going to abandon our gods for the sake of a mad poet"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And to say: What! shall we indeed give up our gods for the sake of a mad poet?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: saying, 'What, shall we forsake our gods for a poet possessed?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And said: Shall we forsake our gods for a mad poet?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and replied, "Shall we then give up our deities at the bidding of a mad poet?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they said: are we going to abandon our gods on account of a Poet distracted?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and [they would] say, ‘Shall we abandon our gods for a crazy poet?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And say: "What! shall we give up our gods for the sake of a Poet possessed?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (they) said: "Are we going to abandon our aliha (gods) for the sake of a mad poet?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and said: 'Are we to renounce our gods for the sake of a mad poet'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And said, “Are we to abandon our gods for a mad poet?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:36] and would say, ‘Are we to abandon our gods for a mad poet?’, that is, for the sake of what Muhammad (s) says? (as regards the hamzas [in a-innā, ‘are we’], the same applies as mentioned above).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And said: Shall we forsake our gods) shall we leave the worship of our gods (for a mad poet) who invents lies? Meaning the Prophet Muhammad (pbuh). 507
